chapter.title: Installation Scenarios
chapter.para: Different scenarios to install &slsreg; for SAP Applications 11 are available. Select the wanted installation scenario from the DVD boot menu:

listitem.para: Booting the system installed on the local hard disk.

Basically a standard SLES installation prepared for installing SAP applications later. You can install the SAP applications either with the provided Installation Wizard or with third party installation routines.
This scenario os suitable for experienced administrators, who want to install &sles4sap; according to their own plan.

varlistentry.term: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard (see )

listitem.para: This is a semi-automated installation of the operating system with default settings. At the end, the Installation Wizard for the installation of SAP applications will be started on demand. The user has the possibility to set the most important parameters for a basic installation of the system and the installation of the specified SAP applications.

varlistentry.term: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with External Profile (see )

listitem.para: This installation is driven by a user provided &ay; profile.
This scenario is suitable for experienced users, who are familiar with with &ay; and want to deploy their own &ay; profiles to install &sles4sap;.
Starting a minimal Linux system without a graphical user interface. For more information, see Chapter 34, Common Problems and Their Solutions of the &admin;.
Testing the system RAM using repeated read and write cycles. For more information, see Chapter 34, Common Problems and Their Solutions of the &admin;.

sect1.para:
The first part is similar to a standard manual &sls; installation; for details about such an SLES installation, see the SLES &deploy;, Chapter 6, Installation with &yast;.
In addition, the SAP Application Server Base (sap-loc and sapconf) pattern will get installed by default and basic settings will be done.

title.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard

sect1.para:
This is a semi-automated installation of the operating system with default settings.
At the end, the Installation Wizard for the installation of SAP applications will be started on demand. The user has the possibility to set the most important parameters for a basic installation of the system and the installation of the specified SAP application.
The following installation and configuration steps will take place, where interactive settings are possible:

sect2.title: Selecting SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard from the DVD Boot Menu
sect2.para: From the DVD boot menu (see ), select SLES for SAP Applications — Wizard. The installation process loads and configures a minimal Linux system to run the installation procedure. To view the boot messages and copyright notices during this process, press Esc. On completion of this process, the &yast; installation program starts and displays the graphical installer, which will run mostly automated.

sect2.title: Preparing System for Automated Installation
sect2.para: After analyzing your computer, the next &yast; popup dialog will let you specify the volume configuration. You will need two volumes, one for the system (and for swap space) and the other one for the application data.
If there is just one hard disk, keep it as the system volume device and set the size of the system volume (and the swap space) in GB in the lower field and confirm it; see .
If there is more than one hard disk, select the right one as the system volume device and set the size of the system volume (and the swap space) in GB in the lower fields and confirm it.

warning.title: Deleting Data
warning.para: If you confirm the storage volume configuration, all existing data on the hard disk will be deleted. If you do not want this to happen, turn off the system.

sect2.para: After confirmation &yast; performs the software installation. Packages are installed one by one, thus you can see the progress.

sect2.title: Password for the System Administrator &rootuser;
sect2.para: When all packages are installed, the basic installation is finished, and the system rebooted for initial configuration, you will be prompted to enter a Password for the System Administrator &rootuser;; see .

&rootuser; is the name of the superuser, or the administrator of the system. Unlike regular users (who may or may not have permission to access certain areas or execute certain commands on the system), &rootuser; has unlimited access to change the system configuration, install programs, and set up new hardware. The &rootuser; account should only be used for system administration, maintenance, and repair. Logging in as &rootuser; for daily work is rather risky: a single mistake could lead to irretrievable loss of system files.
For verification purposes, the password for &rootuser; must be entered twice. Do not forget the &rootuser; password. Once entered, this password cannot be retrieved.
The &rootuser; password can be changed any time later in the installed system. To do so run &yast; and start Security and Users User and Group Management .

warning.title: The root User
warning.para: The user &rootuser; has all the permissions needed to make changes to the system. To carry out such tasks, the &rootuser; password is required. You cannot carry out any administrative tasks without this password.

sect2.title: Hostname, Domain Name, and IP Address
sect2.para: The next dialog starts with the network configuration; see .

figure.title: Hostname, Domain Name, and IP Address

sect2.para: The Hostname is the computer's name in the network. The Domain Name is the name of the network. A hostname and domain are proposed by default. If your system is part of a network, the hostname has to be unique in this network, whereas the domain name has to be common to all hosts on the network.
Also enter the IP Address and Netmask for this host. The IP address must be unique and the netmask has to be common to all hosts on the network.

sect2.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) and Time Server (NTP)
sect2.para: The next dialog continues with the network configuration; see .

figure.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) and Time Server (NTP)

sect2.para: For Domain Name Service (DNS) configuration, enter Domain Searchlist and the IP Address of DNS Server plus the IP address of the Default Gateway of your network.
Also enter the address of the NTP Server to synchronize automatically via Network Time Protocol (NTP).

sect2.title: Registration
sect2.para: To get technical support and product updates, you need to register and activate your product with the &ncc;; see . This dialog provides assistance for doing so. Find detailed information about &ncc; at .
Enter your E-Mail-Address and Registration Code for the product.

sect2.title: Applying Configuration Settings
sect2.para: After confirming the registration data, the automatic configuration with the supplied settings will take place.
No user action is required at this stage.

sect2.title: SAP Product Installation
sect2.para: After applying the configuration settings, you are considered to continue with the SAP Product Installation using the SAP Installation Wizard. Confirm the popup; see . In the next dialog provide the Location of the SAP Installation Master.

title.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with External Profile

sect1.para: This installation is driven by a user provided &ay; profile.

This scenario is suitable for experienced users, who are familiar with with &ay; and want to deploy their own &ay; profiles to install &sles4sap;. Either specify the profile location as a boot option in the DVD Boot Menu, or enter the location when &yast; asks for it in the next dialog.
For more information about &ay; profiles, see the SLES &ay; Guide.
&ay; will look on USB devices for the XML configuration file (external profile). Plug in an USB device and store your config in a way like it is on the DVD in the /rules directory.

In order to use a custom &ay; script or perform a complete manual installation and configuration of &sles4sap; select the "Install SLES for SAP Applications Manual Profile via USB" boot menu entry. Within the boot options change the autoyast=usb:/// parameter to the location of a custom &ay; script to use for automatic installation. Alternatively, completely remove the autoyast=usb:/// parameter to perform a manual installation and configuration of &sles4sap;.
You can choose the SAP specific pattern, the HA, WebYaST components and SAP specific IBM Java as well in this installation scenario, but they are not preselected.

sect1.title: SAP Specific Instructions
sect1.para: For further installation instructions and the SAP specific parts in particular, refer to the SAP Installation Guide (the Cookbook).
